{\rtf1\mac\ansicpg10000\cocoartf824\cocoasubrtf420 {\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa40\qc\pardirnatural
\f0\fs20 \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Linux, Windows XP and Mac OS X\ Ethernet, InfiniBand interconnects\ \ Open standard for parallel rendering\ LGPL license: commercial and open source use\ \ Collaborations welcome\ Consulting and support available}

{\rtf1\mac\ansicpg10000\cocoartf824\cocoasubrtf420 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset77 Georgia-Bold;\f1\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica;\f2\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica-Bold; } {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qc\pardirnatural
\f0\b\fs24 \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Major Features \f1\b0\fs20 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural
\f2\b \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Runtime Configurability: \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 An Equalizer application can run on any configuration, from laptops to large scale visualization clusters, without recompilation. The runtime configuration is externalized from the application to a systemwide resource server.\
\f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Runtime Scalability: \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 An Equalizer application can use multiple CPU's, GPU's and computers to scale the rendering performance of a single view.\
\f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Distributed Execution: \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Equalizer applications can be written to support cluster-based execution. The task of distributing the application data is facilitated by support for versioned, distributed objects.\
\f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Support for Immersive Environments: \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Equalizer supports both active and passive stereo rendering, as well as the head tracking, which is required for immersive Virtual Reality installations.\ A detailed feature list can be found on the website.}

{\rtf1\mac\ansicpg10000\cocoartf824\cocoasubrtf420 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset77 Georgia-Bold;\f1\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica;\f2\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica-Oblique; \f3\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica-Bold;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa380\qc\pardirnatural
\f0\b\fs24 \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Parallel Programming Interface \fs18 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural
\f1\b0\fs20 \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Equalizer uses a \f2\i \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 minimally invasive \f1\i0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 programming interface. Most of the application is unmodified, only the rendering is separated and plugged into the Equalizer API for parallelization. Common graphic entities are abstracted by C++ classes, for example:\ \pard\tx220\tx720\li720\fi-720\qj\pardirnatural
\f3\b \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \'a5 Node \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 - a single computer in the cluster\
\f3\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \'a5 Pipe \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 - a graphics card and rendering thread\
\f3\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \'a5 Window \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 - an OpenGL drawable\ \pard\tx220\tx720\li720\fi-720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural
\f3\b \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \'a5 Channel \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 - a viewport within a window\ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 The application amends these entities with it's rendering code by implementing \f2\i \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 task-specific \f1\i0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 methods. Equalizer simplifies application porting by providing a default implementation for each task, which implements the typical use case.}

{\rtf1\mac\ansicpg10000\cocoartf824\cocoasubrtf420 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset77 Georgia-Bold;\f1\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \deftab720 \pard\pardeftab720\sa360\qc
\f0\b\fs24 \cf0 Transparent OpenGL Layer\ \pard\pardeftab720\sa320\qj
\f1\b0\fs20 \cf0 A transparent OpenGL layer will enable the execution of unmodified OpenGL applications. It allows a seamless integration of unmodified and scalable applications on the same system.\ \pard\pardeftab720\sa360\qc
\f0\b\fs24 \cf0 Distributed Scene Graphs\ \pard\pardeftab720\sa320\qj
\f1\b0\fs20 \cf0 Equalizer will be integrated with popular scene graphs, such as Coin3D or OpenSceneGraph. Applications using these scene graphs can easily implement parallel, scalable applications, and profit from the current and future feature set of Equalizer.\ }

{\rtf1\mac\ansicpg10000\cocoartf824\cocoasubrtf420 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset77 Georgia-Bold;\f1\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica;\f2\fswiss\fcharset77 Helvetica-Bold; } {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qc\pardirnatural
\f0\b\fs24 \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Use Cases \f1\b0\fs20 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ Equalizer abstracts the configuration from the application. This allows the same application to be deployed in many different ways, for example: \f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ Display Walls \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 (top left) are one of the most common use case for visualization clusters today. The typical configuration, as shown on the left, executes one instance of the application's rendering code for each display. \f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ Virtual Reality Installations \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 (bottom left) \f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0
\f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 use passive or active stereo rendering with head tracking, both supported by Equalizer. \f2\b \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 \ Scalable Rendering \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 (right) parallelizes the rendering of a single view across multiple graphic cards, processors and potentially computers to render more data faster.\ \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\sa80\qj\pardirnatural
\f2\b \cf0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 Multipipe Workstations \f1\b0 \expnd0\expndtw0\kerning0 are an affordable way to scale the rendering performance and display size. Equalizer applications can exploit multiple processors and multiple graphic cards by running multiple rendering threads.}
